narrative.title: 4Th Infantry Division - 1942Q4
narrative.situation: British infantry_division deployed in North Africa during 1942Q4.
narrative.objectives: Infantry division in XIII Corps southern sector at Second Battle of El Alamein. Mission: Support 7th Armoured Division operations, hold defensive positions, prevent Axis breakthrough from southern sector.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Western Desert - Southern El Alamein sector (XIII Corps). Mix of sand, rock, and camel scrub. More difficult terrain than northern sector.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Fresh division with full strength and modern equipment
Territorial Army units with strong regional cohesion (Home Counties)
Well-trained in UK before North Africa deployment
Modern 6-pounder anti-tank guns in good supply

environment.terrain_type: Western Desert - Southern El Alamein sector (XIII Corps). Mix of sand, rock, and camel scrub. More difficult terrain than northern sector.
